title: I sincerely wish ADC's would have a more intuitive damage pattern
body:
{{champion:81}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:202}} 
They can deal quite a bit of damage with point and click AA's but to maximize their damage they have to play **well** and hit their abilities.

I can't be the only one who feels somewhat cheated when I get AA'd from 600ish range, with them never even using an ability.
I'm 100% fine with ADC's being late game DPS powerhouses but I'd rather have some counterplay to their damage as I actually feel 101% outskilled when killed by any other class but seeing Twitch, Ashe and Cait just press one button and DPS my team down just like that I can't really appreciate it.

Dunno, just my thoughts on the matter.
I just wished we had more Varus and Jhin style MARKSMEN with high damage skillshots and a damage pattern i can outplay.
I just feel ranged point and click DPS is too archaic in design and funnelling more damage into an ADC's kit would feel a lot cooler to play against.

Actually, AD hominems are also arguments that attack the person and not the argument too, so he simply isn't using the best word, but it isn't incorrect. It's still a fallacy to bring up morde when talking about ADC.

Tu Quoque loosely translates into "Right back at you". 
I can see why you would think it's Ad Hominem, but it isn't. 

The initial argument is about ADC counterplay (more or less).
He turned it around on you by talking about your champion's counterplay.

The argument isn't attacking you.
Ad Hominem would look like:

"You're a Morde player, you don't know what you're talking about."

However, since the argument isn't concluding you, the person, is the reason for the invalidation- it is not Ad Hominem.

The argument is literally a "right back at you" scheme. 

What's being said (more or less) is:
"ADC counterplay? What about Morde counterplay?"

The argument isn't making YOU the subject of invalidation.

This makes it a "Tu Quoque" argument.

[FYI Tu quoque is still a type of logical fallacy of ad hominem.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tu_quoque)

[Edit: If this isn't enough, here is another link from The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy written by Center for the Study of Language and Information (CSLI), Stanford University.](https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/fallacies/)

Sorry, but you're wrong. 
Tu Quoque and Ad Hominem are two separate types of fallacies. 
I'll give you examples of each fallacious rebuttals (and try to keep them as similar as possible):

**Personal opinions should be kept to yourself**
(Ad Hominem): Your opinion is stupid!
(Tu Quoque): Then why are you sharing yours?

**Bernie Sanders should have won the election**
(Ad Hominem): Says the guy who voted for Clinton!
(Tu Quoque): Didn't you vote for Clinton, though?

The key difference is what's being targeted in the rebuttal. 

- Ad Hominem directly attacks the person making the argument: trying to invalidate the argument by invalidating the person making it.
- Tu Quoque directly attacks the argument, and applies it to the person making the argument: trying to invalidate the argument by suggesting it also applies to the person making it.

ADC's are neither. They are generally very safe and have a shitload of damage that comes from unavoidable point and clicks. Sure, every role has brainless point and click champions, but ADC is the definition of point and click. It's the only class that completely relies on point and click for damage. Sure, mages have Annie, but they also have champions like Xerath, Karthus, Vel'koz, in fact, most of the class has dodge-able abilities. Same for Assassins. Sure, Akali is point and click, but Zed needs to land his 3 in 1 skillshot and dodge a shitload of spells in order to land his combo (and is also gated by cooldowns!). What about ADC's? The vast majority of ADC's are just point and click. Sure, we have champions like Ez who's skillshot based or Jhin who has cooldowns on his high damage autos, but the rest of the class is just auto-attack for days. Not saying that ADC doesn't take skill to play, just saying that there isn't much counterplay to the class. I feel like ADC is the class that deserves a massive overhaul the most out of any other class. For several reasons but this is one of them. This is the other problem with the role. But I'm going to have to do a bit of explaining here. ADC is currently very strong right now, but that's fine, because literally every other class in the game does this. Very rarely do we have situations where classes "coexist." Top lane, for example, has always been dived between being a lane for carry picks, and being a lane for tank picks. You never really see the two coexist, although you may see some overlap. ADC, like any other class, cycles between being strong and weak. The problem is, of course, that ADC is the only class in the game that is MANDITORY. That is, that even if ADC class is absolute garbage (think back when ADC in 2k17 was a relevant meme.) They still need to be picked because in pro-play, you need someone who can shred towers at a safe distance. And the meta then trickles down to solo-queue as pros and pro streamers pick these meta champs, and eventually everyone decides to copy the pro's meta because they want the freelo. Sure, maybe playing Darius bot or Yasuo bot is really good, possibly even better than ADC's, but in incredibly high elo, and I'm talking challenger here, its always a better choice to get someone with ranged. Because ADC is the only class in the game that is manditory, it ends up feeling really bad to play when the role sucks, and it feels overwhelming to play against when the role is good. In the case of any other role, this is fine because if the class sucks, you could always just pick a different class to fit that lane. Not with botlane though. They are stuck playing the role of ADC no matter what. This is why the stereotype of ADC mains being whiny babies came up. They are like this because their role genuinely sucks to play when its weak as shit. This is absolutely why moving ADC out of being mandatory botlane, and in turn allowing other roles to go to the duo lane would be better for game health. Making it so that metas could exist without ADC's, but also having metas exist where ADC's outside of the botlane other than those same championsthat everyone brings up. (make it so all ADC's are semi-viable mid for example, in the same way that almost all mages are at least playable as supports.) That way players that are attached to the marksmen playstyle can play their mains in other lanes, where as more variety can start to appear botlane, and so that one player doesn't get stuck having to play the shitty ADC. 

Because of ADC's being required, Riot also needs to buff them up quickly and make them overpowered if they ever become to weak, which is what happened during the pre-season where ADC was considered in its worse state possibly ever. I remember specifically a reddit post where a Rioter talked about this exact thing.
